summary: Vanessa Santillan 's body was found in a £ 400,000 flat in Fulham , London . The 33-year-old Mexican national died as a result of injuries to the head and neck . Police have arrested a man in connection with her death but have bailed him .

aspect: - A man has been arrested in connection with the death of a transgender escort found strangled and beaten last month in a £400,000 flat in Fulham, south west London.
- Vanessa Santillan's body was found with injuries to the head and neck.
- A 23-year-old man was arrested but has been bailed and told to return to a London police station for further questioning.
- Scotland Yard is appealing to anyone who may have had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death.
- Miss Santillan worked as a transgender escort in London, Paris, and Miami.
- Police did not confirm whether her profession was central to the investigation but insisted they would do 'everything' to solve the case.
- London Ambulance Service was called to a flat in Romily Court, Fulham, on March 28 at around 9:30pm.
- Miss Santillan was pronounced dead at the scene having suffered injuries to her head and neck.
- Miss Santillan is understood to have moved to London from Mexico.
- Miss Santillan spoke of her love for London and Paris online in the weeks before her death.
- Police are urging anyone who had contact with her in the hours before her death to come forward.
- Detective Chief Inspector Rebecca Reeves leads the investigation and wants to know why this has happened and needs help from anyone who knew her while she was in London.
- In the weeks before her death Miss Santillan took to social media to talk of her love for London.
- Miss Santillan's body was found when London Ambulance Service was called to an address in Fulham, south west London.
explain:
A transgender escort was found strangled and beaten last month in a £400,000 flat in Fulham, south west London. A man has been arrested in connection with her death.
Core Idea: The aspect discusses the arrest of a man in connection with the murder of a transgender escort found strangled and beaten in a £400,000 flat in Fulham, south west London.

The core idea of the aspect "Vanessa Santillan's body was found with injuries to the head and neck" is that the 33-year-old Mexican national died as a result of injuries caused to these parts of her body.

The aspect states that a 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with Vanessa Santillan's death. However, he has since been released on bail and is required to return to a London police station for further questioning. This means that he is still a person of interest in the case, but is not currently in police custody.
Scotland Yard is seeking to gather more information about Vanessa Santillan's activities leading up to her death and is asking for help from the public in this regard.

Working as a transgender escort, Miss Santillan was engaged in the sex industry and solicited clients to engage in sexual activities for financial compensation. This aspect of her life may have put her at risk and made her more vulnerable to dangerous situations.

The aspect states that the police did not confirm if Vanessa Santillan's profession was central to the investigation, but they assured that they will do everything to solve the case. This implies that the police are not disclosing any information regarding the connection of her profession with the investigation. However, the police reassure that they are leaving no stone unturned to solve the case.
The London Ambulance Service was called to a flat in Romily Court, Fulham, on March 28 at around 9:30pm in connection with Vanessa Santillan's death.
